title: Should we double the inflation target to 4pc?
text:
Imagine you have £100,000 in the bank. But then imagine a world where interest rates are suddenly close to zero and 4pc inflation is the norm: after five years, your pot is worth nearly £18,000 less in today’s terms. After a decade, a third has been wiped out.

Savers are at the sharp end of inflation, and for the last 30 years central banks have been waging a war against a phenomenon once labelled as “violent as a mugger and as deadly as a hit-man” by former president Ronald Reagan.

But the challenge has changed as, in many economies around the world, the problem is now too little inflation - rather than too much. And in monetary policy circles a debate is raging about whether central banks...
